_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The five drawbacks for an unethical pers: An unethical person loses substantial wealth on account of negligence.
An unethical person gets a bad reputation.
An unethical person enters any kind of assembly timid and embarrassed.
An unethical person feels lost when they die.
An unethical person, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
The five benefits for an ethical person: An ethical person gains substantial wealth on account of diligence.
An ethical person gets a good reputation.
An ethical person enters any kind of assembly bold and self-assured.
An ethical person dies not feeling lost.
When an ethical person’s body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
